Data: 7.05pm: Australia have won the toss and will field, they have made one change to their side: Nic Maddinson coming in for Nathan Reardon. South Africa have shaken things up after being hammered in Melbourne, with David Wiese, Robbie Peterson and Marchant de Lange all coming into the XI.
Bollinger to de Kock, no run gallops in, pitches slightly back of a length, on middle and leg, de Kock taps gently into the on side
Bollinger to de Kock, 1 run length on the stumps, angling in with the arm and worked into a gap at midwicket this time
Bollinger to Hendricks, no run Dougie's close to 140kph, getting decent carry as the right-handed Hendricks leaves a length ball in the channel
Bollinger to Hendricks, no run pulls out of the shot, short ball from Bollinger, skips off the surface and Hendricks aborts his horizontal swipe
Bollinger to Hendricks, 1 run goodish length, maybe a touch short and pushed across towards the slips, Hendricks opens the bat face and runs one to third man

Bollinger to de Kock, FOUR runs flicked off the pads, de Kock using the angle and Bollinger's pace, this is neatly played because it has eluded James Faulkner running from deep square leg, diving attempt but can't prevent the ball rolling on to the ropes
Maxwell to Hendricks, 1 run around the wicket, flat and around the line of off, Hendrick nurdles to the leg side for one
Maxwell to de Kock, 1 run fuller length, de Kock leans out and dabs one into a gap at midwicket
Maxwell to Hendricks, 1 run darted on leg stump, 93kph and again clipped off the pads for a single
Maxwell to de Kock, no run on the stumps, reaches out and drives to find the cover fielder on the edge of the ring
Maxwell to de Kock, 1 run goes back and opens the face, short third man does good work but can't prevent the single
Maxwell to Hendricks, 1 run tight line on the stumps and primly tucked through the leg side for one more
Bollinger to Hendricks, 1 run on the stumps, Hendricks nudges off his hips into a gap at short midwicket
Bollinger to de Kock, no run beaten for pace, back of a length and de Kock rolled his wrists on an attempted pull, no bat on it
Bollinger to de Kock, 1 run shuffles across and steers the ball into a gap at midwicket
Bollinger to Hendricks, no run good line from Bollinger, no room for Hendricks to swing the arms, blocked back towards the bowler
Bollinger to Hendricks, no run Dougie likes this, gives the batsman a stare in his follow through, Hendricks only able to prod a length ball to point
Bollinger to Hendricks, 1 run length in the channel, 139kph and Hendricks gets this away down to third man, gliding it off the face
Faulkner to Hendricks, 1 run starts on the money and Hendricks inside-edges through his legs, short fine leg is quickly on it but needed a direct hit to test de Kock

Faulkner to de Kock, SIX runs gets hold of him and that's a Dorothy, straight down the ground! Pitched up and de Kock targets the short boundary, free swing of the arms and it thuds into the boards - lovely sight
Faulkner to de Kock, no run length delivery and de Kock pulls at it, doesn't manage to connect
Faulkner to de Kock, 1 run skips forward and manufactures a cross-batted drive wide of mid-off
Faulkner to Hendricks, no run on the stumps, length delivery pushed back to the bowler
Faulkner to Hendricks, 1 run fuller, in the channel, Hendricks is forward on the drive and a thickish edge runs to third man
Bollinger to Hendricks, FOUR runs back of a length and carted over backward square, Hendricks has got this away, swivelled quickly to flip it off his hips
Bollinger to Hendricks, 2 runs back of a length and paddled of the stumps through midwicket for a couple
Bollinger to Hendricks, FOUR runs width and sliced over backward point this time, Bollinger doesn't have any cover out there and Hendricks carves himself another four
Bollinger to Hendricks, 1 run stays in the crease and steers this one down to third man

Bollinger to de Kock, FOUR runs dismissive from de Kock, pulled powerfully over mid-on and away for the third boundary of the over! The pitch is maybe holding up a touch, Bollinger not quite quick enough and de Kock batters him
Bollinger to de Kock, 1 run shortish, goes back and deflects one to short third man
Abbott to de Kock, 1 wide down the leg side, de Kocks swings hard... wide
Abbott to de Kock, no run better line, in the channel outside off, de Kock heaves again, misses
Abbott to de Kock, FOUR runs back of a length, at the batsman, helped round the corner and this beats short fine leg and will run away
Abbott to de Kock, FOUR runs smeared over cover, de Kock is on the charge! Using the feet again, comes out to thump a length ball to the boundary
Abbott to de Kock, 2 runs dug in shorter, the connection on the pull isn't clean but they pick up a couple into the leg side
Abbott to de Kock, 2 runs opens up his stance and steers the ball through point, they get back for two
Abbott to de Kock, 1 run angled across the lefty, who goes back and chops one more through backward point
Maxwell to de Kock, 1 run length ball outside off, clipped down the ground
Maxwell to Hendricks, 1 run on the stumps, worked off the legs
Maxwell to de Kock, 1 run flat and around the line of off, de Kock gets forward and steers one more into a gap on the off side
Maxwell to Hendricks, no run very full, dips a little on off stump and Hendricks drops his bat on it
Maxwell to Hendricks, 2 runs allows this to come across him and steers the ball through cover point, wide of the sweeper
Maxwell to Hendricks, 1 run full, gives this a bit of flight, flicked away through midwicket
Boyce to Hendricks, 1 run starts with a legbreak that skis on a little low outside off, Hendricks jabs it away
Boyce to de Kock, no run tossed up, on the stumps, de Kock comes down the track and jams his bat next to pad
Boyce to de Kock, 1 run gives this some air, de Kock comes out of his crease, cross-bats it down the ground to long-off
Boyce to Hendricks, 1 run tossed up on middle and off, worked through the leg side
Boyce to de Kock, FOUR runs whipped away, de Kock wristily pulling a length ball flat and hard, it spins and pierces the gap behind deep midwicket, super stroke
Boyce to de Kock, 2 runs flighted, worked with the turn through the leg side, finds space again - de Kock is sailing here
Cummins to Hendricks, no run starts in the channel outside off, good length and steered straight to point
Cummins to Hendricks, 1 run Hendricks this time goes back and guides a similar-length delivery down to third man

Cummins to de Kock, SIX runs slower ball, de Kock hasn't picked this... but he's still hit it for six! He was aiming down the ground and that's where it ended up, just managing to clear the rope despite the miscue

Cummins to de Kock, OUT got him, Cummins makes the breakthrough with a fast short ball! Banged in, little bit of cut on the ball and de Kock was hurried trying to pull, just a tickle of glove and it's safely pouched by Dunk
Cummins to Rossouw, 2 runs good length, outside off and 141kph, nicely played first ball, leaning out to drive wide of the man at cover
Cummins to Rossouw, 1 run short again and this is pulled fiercely through midwicket to the man in the deep
Maxwell to Rossouw, 1 run on the stumps and worked through the leg side
Maxwell to Hendricks, no run angled across, plays back in the crease and a thick outside edge falls short of point
Maxwell to Hendricks, no run flat and straight, can't get this through the leg side
Maxwell to Hendricks, 2 runs tight lines from Maxwell, darting the ball in, this time Hendricks manages to find a gap at deep midwicket
Maxwell to Hendricks, 2 runs on the stumps, worked away into a gap off the pads for two more
Maxwell to Hendricks, 1 run flat, outside off, driven into the ground and White can't grab it at cover, they pick up one on the misfield
Cummins to Hendricks, no run back of a length, 142kph and blocked back on the leg side
Cummins to Hendricks, FOUR runs short ball, climbing outside off, clattered to backward square leg on the pull, superb timing from Hendricks
Cummins to Hendricks, no run back of a length and again in the channel, not short enough to pull and Hendricks lets the ball through
Cummins to Hendricks, no run goes across his stumps and works to the ball to leg, fielded in the ring
Cummins to Hendricks, no run length in the channel and dabbed into the covers
Cummins to Hendricks, no run slightly fuller, Hendricks closes the face and again works the ball to midwicket - another dot and an excellent over from Cummins, having been hit for four second ball

Boyce to Rossouw, OUT tossed up, Rossouw charges... and picks out long-on! Success for Boyce, he keeps tossing it up, Rossouw was trying to clear the short, straight boundary - the ball was a little wide, he wasn't to the pitch and dragged it straight to the fielder
Boyce to Miller, 2 runs pitching and straightening outside leg, flicked fine and Bollinger has to give chase
Boyce to Miller, 1 run gives this some air, spinning back in from outside off, cut away off the back foot
Boyce to Hendricks, 1 run flatter and outside the right-hander's off stump, punched through the off side to the sweeper
Boyce to Miller, 1 run goes across and clips another business-like single through the covers
Boyce to Hendricks, no run tossed up, straightens and takes the outside edge, loops safely into the off side
Maxwell to Miller, no run on the stumps, can't get this away
Maxwell to Miller, 1 run darted down around off stump, Miller plants through front foot and forces this through the covers
Maxwell to Hendricks, FOUR runs fullish and straight, Hendricks gets down the pitch and hoicks over wide long-on, well struck and it bounces away for four
Maxwell to Hendricks, 1 run flat trajectory, nurdled away through square leg
Maxwell to Miller, 1 run goes deep in the crease, pushes one down the ground
Maxwell to Hendricks, no run pushed through flatter on off stump, Hendricks jams the bat down on it
Boyce to Miller, FOUR runs tossed up, Miller is quickly out of the crease and clubs this straight back down the ground, no one is stopping that
Boyce to Miller, 1 run flatter and worked off the pads through midwicket
Boyce to Hendricks, 1 run pushed through outside off, drops back and steers one through the off side
Boyce to Miller, 1 run happy to stay in the crease and punch down the ground
Boyce to Hendricks, FOUR runs flighted, full and swept, superb connection from Hendricks, a controlled stroke and it skips away past the fielder at deep square leg
Boyce to Hendricks, 1 run pushed through and Hendricks drops back, punches through the covers for another single
Faulkner to Hendricks, no run starts on a length outside off, maybe a change of pace and Hendricks fails to get bat on ball
Faulkner to Hendricks, 1 run angled in and this time Hendricks flicks the ball away to leg
Faulkner to Miller, no run length on off stump, Miller can only jab it back towards the bowler
Faulkner to Miller, 1 run slightly back of a length, 136kph, Miller pushes through mid-on, just a single
Faulkner to Hendricks, 1 run pushed across the right-hander, who reaches out to steer through the covers
Faulkner to Miller, 1 run accurate stuff from Faulkner, whipped away through midwicket for one more
Bollinger to Miller, 1 run slightly back of a length, Miller sits in the crease and clips through square leg

Bollinger to Hendricks, OUT Dougie does it, Hendricks drags on! The ball was short and there to pull but maybe Bollinger had rolled his fingers over it, the batsman misjudged the stroke, bottom-edged the ball on to his body and then down to shiver leg stump. Falls just short of the fifty mark, like his opening partner
Bollinger to Behardien, no run skips down the pitch and tries to heave a length ball over midwicket, swings and misses
Bollinger to Behardien, 1 leg bye leg-stump line again, aims to leg and the ball rolls away off the pad
Bollinger to Miller, no run back of a length, 133kph but zipping through and above Miller's flat-batted swipe
Bollinger to Miller, 2 runs it's the bluff, Bollinger goes full and straight, Miller gets a chunk of inside edge on it and deep midwicket has to race in, they sprint for two
Faulkner to Behardien, no run length ball, angled across, Behardien plinks it into the off side
Faulkner to Behardien, 1 run back-of-the-hand slower ball from Faulkner, bottom-edged pull through square leg as Behardien again tries to hit a home run
Faulkner to Miller, 1 run short of a length, at the body, Miller swivel-pulls to leg

Faulkner to Behardien, OUT shortish and taken on... only to pick out deep midwicket! Behardien's brief, painful sally is brought to a close, slogging across the line but never had to the distance to that part of the ground
Faulkner to Miller, 2 runs short again, Faulkner making the batsmen go square of the wicket, pulled into the deep for a couple
Faulkner to Miller, FOUR runs too full and Miller scorches a drive down the ground, wide of long-off, a powerful counterpunch to finish the over
Cummins to Duminy, no run banged in short, Duminy skips forward, mistime his pull back down the track
Cummins to Duminy, 1 run short again, Duminy swats a pull away into the midwicket region
Cummins to Miller, 1 run slower ball from Cummins, short again and cross-batted through the leg side
Cummins to Duminy, 1 bye another slower-ball bumper, down the leg side - maybe lucky not to be a wide - Duminy swings and misses but the low bounce foxes Dunk and they take a bye
Cummins to Miller, 1 run short, another cutter, pulled flat out towards deep midwicket

Cummins to Duminy, 1 run Cummins continues to hit the middle of the pitch and limit the pace the batsman has to use again him, swatted into the midwicket region, they think about two but the fielder is quickly in

Faulkner to Duminy, OUT tries to get to the pitch, Duminy lifts a length ball to deep midwicket! Another one goes, the SA innings is dribbling to a close... He was hitting across the line and didn't really get hold of it
Faulkner to Miller, 1 run back of a length, Miller steps away and drags one down the ground to long-on

Faulkner to Wiese, OUT gone first ball, edging a pull through to the keeper! Two in three balls for Faulkner, the slump continues. It was another back-of-a-length delivery, Wiese hadn't got his eye in and succeeded only in feathering it through to Dunk
Faulkner to Peterson, 1 run shortish, Peterson comes forward and slices a single to backward point
Faulkner to Miller, FOUR runs HEADS! Faulkner has to take evasive action here, slightly too full and Miller nearly turns killer with a scud missile of a drive straight back down the pitch. Phwoar
Faulkner to Miller, 1 run uses the feet and swings hard at a length ball, big top edge but it sails safely out towards deep cover to keep Miller on strike
Cummins to Miller, no run dug in short and there's a big appeal as Miller aims a pull, deflects through to the keeper - well spotted, ump, that came off the shoulder
Cummins to Miller, 1 run another bumper, connects with this one, swatted into the deep but they're kept to a single
Cummins to Peterson, no run back of a length, cutting his fingers over it, Peterson swipes and misses
Cummins to Peterson, 1 run slower ball, Peterson drops right back in the crease and deflects it to point, Miller was already halfway down
Cummins to Miller, 1 run banged in halfway down and pulled forcefully but too close to deep midwicket, Peterson half-heartedly sets off for a second but has to go back

Cummins to Peterson, 2 runs short, again taking the pace off, Peterson shovels it awkwardly into the leg side, deep midwicket has a lot of ground to cover and they come scrambling back for the second - still, a magnificent over from Cummins at the last

9.05pm: After a blistering opening stand of 75, South Africa managed just 29 runs from the last five overs, as Australia set up a very effective roadblock. Pat Cummins again looked the business - now the batsmen must try to seal the deal. The consensus seems to be that 145 is short of par but SA at least had an excellent tutorial in how to bowl on this
Right, take your seats and hold on to your hats. Aaron Finch and Ben Dunk are out in the middle. Kyle Abbott has the new ball
Abbott to Dunk, 3 runs length ball angled across the left-hander from over the wicket, Dunk lashes it through the covers straight up, pierces the field and they pick up three
Abbott to Finch, no run good length, 136kph and nipping away a touch as Finch fails to connect with a booming drive... Just inside the tramlines
Abbott to Finch, no run touch shorter and closer to off stump, Finch hops back and blocks
Abbott to Finch, no run pitched up, around the line of off, punched back down the track and Abbott sticks out a hand to field
Abbott to Finch, no run excellent line, straightening slightly in the channel outside off, Finch presses forwards, gets an inside edge on to pad
Abbott to Finch, 1 run drifts slightly leg side but Finch gets a leading edge, loops short of mid-on and they scamper a single
de Lange to Finch, FOUR runs short and clubbed away! Finch goes across his stumps and muscles the first boundary of the innings
de Lange to Finch, no run banged in again, this time Finch flinches underneath it
de Lange to Finch, no run hit on the pads, good pace, above 140 kays from de Lange, maybe a touch high and doing too much
de Lange to Finch, 2 runs length outside off, 143kph but Finch uses that to his advantage, just stuns a drive through extra cover for a couple
de Lange to Finch, 3 wide fired down the leg side and this Jack-in-the-boxes up to hit de Kock on the finger tips and run away
de Lange to Finch, no run beaten outside off, this is up at 146kph, zips through in the channel as Finch sits back and wafts at it

de Lange to Finch, FOUR runs just a fraction short and walloped, four more through square leg! Finch was so quick to seize on that, using the pace and flipping the ball over the infield for another boundary
Abbott to Dunk, 1 run squirts a single towards point
Abbott to Finch, no run pitched up and on-driven by Finch, lovely stroke but the ball races to mid-on
Abbott to Finch, 2 runs slightly back of a length, angling in with the arm, Finch closes the face and tucks a couple into a gap in front of square
Abbott to Finch, no run length ball on middle and off, Finch turns the ball off his front pad to midwicket
Abbott to Finch, no run decent line from Abbott, 137kph, blocked back to the bowler
Abbott to Finch, 1 run on the stumps, pushed towards mid-on for a single
Parnell to Finch, SIX runs overpitched, slightly wide and battered over wide long-off for six! Set the base and launched that beyond the boundary
Parnell to Finch, 2 runs shuffles across and whips a couple through the leg side
Parnell to Finch, no run length ball in the channel, Finch rocks back to crash a cut shot.. straight to point. That was smoked
Parnell to Finch, SIX runs too full again from Parnell, crunched hiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiigh into the crowd at long-on! That's the sort of stroke that makes Finch-hitting such a wonderful sight
Parnell to Finch, 1 run fullish, 138kph and Finch heaves again, inside-edges on to his front pad, they pinch one
Parnell to Dunk, no run better length, skids on and deflects off the body towards backward point
Wiese to Finch, 2 runs fullish and on the stumps, Finch clubs this to the leg side for a couple
Wiese to Finch, 2 runs length, this is played a bit more delicately, into a vacant space and they come back for two
Wiese to Finch, no run cutter from Wiese, rolls the fingers over it, Finch defends
Wiese to Watson, no run slightly full outside off, Watson comes forward and opens the face towards point
Wiese to Watson, no run pitched up, full and sliding to leg, flicks the pads on its way through to de Kock who sprawls to stop it smartly
de Lange to Dunk, 3 runs pitched up, slightly full and Dunk drives three more through the covers
de Lange to Watson, 1 run leg side and flicked away for Watson's first run
de Lange to Dunk, no run short and lickety-split, beats Dunk's short-arm pull, zipping through at 146kph
de Lange to Dunk, 1 run pitched up, slightly wide and Dunk has to stretch to slap one down to third man
de Lange to Watson, no run steams in, back of a length, climbing up above off stump as Watson jumps back to defend
de Lange to Watson, 1 run full and tailing in on middle and leg, flicked to backward square, they take on the throw for a single with room to spare
Peterson to Watson, no run angled in and skipping on, hitting the pad as Watson played to leg
Peterson to Watson, 1 run darted with the arm towards middle and leg, Watson flicks this away for a single
Peterson to Dunk, SIX runs tossed up, Dunk takes a couple of steps out and deposits the ball beyond the boundary, that's a shot of intent

Peterson to Dunk, OUT on the attack again - but he's hit it straight into Peterson's bread basket! Really sharp catch and he squeals in celebration... Dunk didn't get to the pitch this time, the ball maybe gripped a little and hit higher up the bat, still flew pretty quickly but Peterson was alert to grab the chance
Peterson to Maddinson, no run over the wicket, flat and outside off, punched into the covers
Peterson to Maddinson, no run pushed through around the line of off, Maddinson comes forward and drives powerfully, straight back to the bowler
Wiese to Watson, 1 run in the channel, slightly full and punched down the ground to long-on
Wiese to Maddinson, 1 run dug in short, a touch slower, Maddinson whips it away through backward square as the man on the rope comes in
Wiese to Watson, 1 run touch short, worked off the hips and this could be tight for Maddinson... but the throw from backward square is well off beam
Wiese to Maddinson, 2 runs short ball, Maddinson dances out and slaps it cross-batted through mid-on for a couple
Wiese to Maddinson, 1 run Wiese focusing on the middle of the pitch, worked away to leg
Wiese to Watson, 2 wide Wiese might be a bit unfortunate here, short, slower ball, over the ducking Watson, the bounce defeats de Kock and they run an extra on the wide
Peterson to Watson, 1 wide fired through, down the leg side as Watson attempts to sweep

Peterson to Watson, OUT a wicket follows a wide again, Watson ballooning a drive to extra cover running back! The ball was wider than Watson would have liked, he skipped out but made a mess of trying to smash this down the ground. It's another fast start followed by a stumble - but whose will be more damaging?
Peterson to Maxwell, no run angled in and defended with a straight bat pressing forwards
Peterson to Maxwell, 1 run on the stumps and nudged through the leg side
Peterson to White, no run length ball, maybe straightening a fraction on off stump, White blocks coming forwards
Peterson to White, no run flat and on off stump, White dabs short on the off side
Peterson to White, 1 run pushed through outside off, opens the face and steers a single through point
Parnell to White, FOUR runs superb shot from White, too full again from Parnell and he just leaned into this straight drive, eased it down the ground
Parnell to White, 1 run goes back and runs a short ball to third man
Parnell to Maxwell, no run back of a length, flying through outside off as Maxwell dangles his bat a little aimlessly
Parnell to Maxwell, 2 runs continues to drop short, Maxwell runs this through backward point and gets back for two
Parnell to Maxwell, 1 run shuffles around in the crease and pulls to midwicket
Parnell to White, FOUR runs hammered for another boundary, dug in at the batsman, White swivelled like a ballerina and cracked four to deep backward square
Peterson to Maxwell, SIX runs ho ho, here we go, that's a beaut of a strike down the ground, many a row into the stand! Skipped out and smashed down the ground, such a clean strike
Peterson to Maxwell, 1 run tries to get cute now, attempting a sort of reverse paddle, loops an edge into the leg side but gets away with it
Peterson to White, 1 run White gets the reverse away past de Kock for a single
Peterson to Maxwell, no run on the stumps, taps this into the leg side
Peterson to Maxwell, FOUR runs tossed up, reverse-sweep from Maxwell and the ball cannons off the bat, racing through backward point and away for four
Peterson to Maxwell, 2 runs flat and wide, Maxwell clubs it through the covers, long-off runs around the boundary to cut it off
Wiese to White, 1 run on the stumps, punched down the ground to long-on
Wiese to Maxwell, no run length outside off, maybe a slower ball and Maxwell is perilously close to playing on, inside-edges on to his pad
Wiese to Maxwell, 1 run another cutter, worked away through the leg side

Wiese to White, no run length ball, punched into the ground and Wiese snatches it reaching to his right, then throws down the stumps as White regains his ground... Wiese makes sure the ricochet doesn't cost a run, either. Good work
Wiese to White, 1 run drags this short outside off, taking the pace off, White paddles one through midwicket
Wiese to Maxwell, FOUR runs impudent, super flicked four from Maxwell, waiting to play the pull shot really late and directing it fine of the boundary rider
Peterson to White, 1 run on the stumps, reverse sweep and de Kock anticipates it, taking some of the pace off
Peterson to White, no run angled in and played back to the bowler
Peterson to White, 1 run turned into the leg side

Peterson to Maxwell, OUT Maxwell whirls the arms but this is a huge top edge... superbly taken on the run by deep midwicket! Just as the match seemed to be back in Australia's court, the required rate only a run-a-ball, Maxwell has exploded all over himself. Third wicket for Peterson, equalling his T20I best
Peterson to White, 1 run darted on off stump, White pushes a single to long-off
de Lange to White, 1 run short ball, over the stumps, White walks to the off side and flicks it away through backward square
de Lange to Faulkner, 1 run steams in, short of a length again, Faulkner dabs to midwicket and runs one-and-a-half
de Lange to White, no run length ball outside off, driven on the up into the covers
de Lange to White, no run short and down the leg side, White had walked across his stumps and can't reach with his pull - the umpire gives de Lange the doubt
de Lange to White, 1 run slightly full, in the channel, White comes forward to punch through the covers
de Lange to Faulkner, 1 run length ball on off stump, backs away and dabs one down to third man
Parnell to Faulkner, no run dug in, punched into the covers, dot ball
Parnell to Faulkner, 1 run short and angled across, Faulkner goes back and deflects a single down to third man
Parnell to White, SIX runs oh, that's marvellous, White picks the full delivery and swings a golf shot into the crowd at long-off, smoking stroke
Parnell to White, 1 run skips out and punches a single through extra cover this time
Parnell to Faulkner, no run banged in short, Faulkner pulls into the ground, mistimed and it rolls to midwicket
Parnell to Faulkner, 1 wide short again, sprayed across as Faulkner made room for himself, can't reach it and called wide
Parnell to Faulkner, no run follows Faulkner to leg, an inside edge squirts to backward point
de Lange to White, FOUR runs super shot, de Lange pitches full on leg stump and White just smuggles it away to the rope with a flick of bat
de Lange to White, no run back of a length, turned short to the on side
de Lange to White, 1 run short and straight, he's up on his toes to pull fine but the fielder has got this covered
de Lange to Faulkner, SIX runs oof, now Faulkner goes downtown! Bludgeoned off a length, a baseball slog but there's enough timber to carry it over the rope at long-on
de Lange to Cummins, no run quick and on a length in the channel, Cummins hops back correctly and raises his bat out of the way
Abbott to White, FOUR runs short ball, a gimme halftracker really and White gratefully plucks four with a controlled pull behind square
Abbott to White, 1 run whipped off the stumps to the man at backward square, bit of a scramble but they make the single
Abbott to Cummins, no run around off stump, Cummins stays back and pokes at the ball
Abbott to Cummins, 1 run length ball, on the stumps, dropped short into the leg side and they charge through for one more
Abbott to White, 1 run full length, tailing in on the stumps, White clips another single to long-on
Abbott to Cummins, 2 runs short delivery, Cummins swings a lollipop pull in the air through square leg, no one is there and they take an easy two
Wiese to White, 1 run fullish, around off stump, White happy to push down the ground and trust his partner
Wiese to Cummins, no run angled in and worked to leg, midwicket keeps Cummins on strike
Wiese to Cummins, no run short, maybe a cutter, Cummins toe ends a pull into the ground and Wiese hares after it
Wiese to Abbott, no run fullish, on off stump, Abbott leans out and prods back watchfully to mid-on
Wiese to Abbott, 1 wide slower ball, Abbott has a swish and misses - but it was just outside the tramline
Wiese to Abbott, no run slightly back of a length outside off, draws his bat inside the line
Parnell to White, 1 run over the wicket, on a length, White closes the face and calmly tucks one through square leg
Parnell to Abbott, no run back of a length, this is quick, 144kph and searing through outside off as Abbott swings the bat wildly

Parnell to Abbott, FOUR runs short again, not a bad ball... but superbly played, ramping four fine of third man! The delivery was right over the top of the stumps but Abbott did terrifically well to use the pace and flick it to the rope, past the diving fielder
Parnell to Abbott, 1 run dug in, at the batsman, pulled into the ground for a comfortable single
Parnell to White, 1 run back of a length, White nudges one more to deep midwicket

Parnell to Abbott, no run goes for the full bunger, Abbott swings hard - and smacks a bump ball back into his partner White, actually hit him on the neck as he tried to duck. More importantly, it was a dot ball
Abbott to White, 1 run pitched up, White plays away from his body, gets an inside edge on to pad, looked for a moment like he had played on
Abbott to Abbott, no run full and wide and Abbott has a swing and a miss

Abbott to Boyce, 1 run pitched up outside off, Boyce drives behind square, into the ground but straight to the fielder, White calls him through - would have been out with a direct hit but Peterson's throw misses! Scores are level

Abbott to White, 1 run full bunger in the blockhole, White chops it away to midwicket, it's not taken cleanly and he's off, charging through for the winning run - Australia win by two wickets with one last itty-bitty ball to spare!
Australia won by 2 wickets (with 1 ball remaining)
Player of the match is Cameron White, AUS
